entry.title: Mooy set for Celtic // Blackburn reaction
entry.summary:
Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images
Many have said it should happen, and probably would have at some point, now it’s practically confirmed - Aaron Mooy is all but set to sign for Celtic.
Celtic are set to sign Aaron Mooy on free transfer. Full agreement in place, been told contract will be valid until June 2023 with an option to extend for further season. ⚪️ #CelticFC Deal will be completed this week after he left Shanghai. pic.twitter.com/9FqfQpkIrK— Fabrizio Romano (@FabrizioRomano) July 17, 2022
The tap in merchant of confirmed transfers has tweeted it, and we should expect to see Mooy confirmed by the club in the next few days. We’ll have more of an opinion on Mooy on the podcast as well and discuss it thoroughly rather than shooting at this time on a Sunday night when rational emotions are nowhere to be seen! We’re sure 67HailHail will have one of the Aussie pundits on to chat about him too. And speaking of 67HailHail, there was a reaction to the 2-2 draw with Blackburn at the weekend:

But if there is one thing to be deduced from Celtic’s four warm-up encounters to date this summer, it’s that it is unlikely to be a dull season once again under Ange Postecoglou. There were just the four goals this time as they played out a 2-2 draw with English Championship side Blackburn Rovers, first-half strikes from Jota and David Turnbull turning round an early deficit after Sam Gallagher had scored for the visitors in the opening couple of minutes. entry.title: 3 Celtic things we learned as champions draw with Blackburn
entry.summary: Unusual slow start It took just 22-seconds for the visitors to take the lead in the match. Some poor mis control in midfield by allowed Blackburn’s attackers to latch onto the ball. A lovely reverse through-ball from Jack Vale slipped in Sam Gallagher. The big striker made no mistake inside the box as he slammed home past Joe Hart. Without doubt, the sloppiness was highly unlike Celtic’s midfield and defensive players. With it being a friendly, of course it doesn’t matter in the grand scheme of things. However, there’s no denying that Postecoglou will not want to a repeat of those mistakes when the league season starts in two weeks. Celtic are always a threat going forward, but it’s also clear at they’re far too open at the back still and are therefore susceptible to losing goals against decent opposition.
